channel.title: RNZ New Zealand Headlines
channel.description: The Latest New Zealand headlines from RNZ News

item.title: Police using algorithms 'a huge problem' for biases, researcher says
item.description: A researcher is worried the proliferation of crime-fighting computer algorithms will only make ingrained police bias against MÄori worse.

item.title: Who's eating New Zealand: What your cat is eating
item.description: Our feline friends are dining on a range of imported food, but purrfer the cuisine of one country over its competitors.

item.title: Police union demands more safety for officers after shooting incidents
item.description: The Police Association is demanding improvements to make frontline police officers feel safer after two separate shooting incidents in the space of 24 hours.

item.title: Essential skills visas extended for some foreign workers
item.description: At least 18,000 foreign workers will be allowed to stay in New Zealand twice as long under changes to essential skill visas for people in jobs paying below the median wage.

item.title: Fears lives are being put at risk due to mental health wait times
item.description: Some Wellington children and teenagers with severe mental health needs are facing more than six month wait times.

item.title: Crash on Auckland's Southern Motorway causes delays
item.description: A police officer was injured while attending a car crash in Auckland after another vehicle crashed into the back of the police car.

item.title: More details to consider behind big drop in jobseeker beneficiaries
item.description: The government is counting another drop in unemployment numbers as a win - but others say the figures don't paint the whole picture.

item.title: Quarantine-free travel from Victoria to New Zealand paused
item.description: Quarantine-free travel from Victoria to New Zealand will be paused from early tomorrow morning, as the Australian state goes into a snap five-day lockdown tonight.

item.title: Napier's council-owned housing may have to be sold
item.description: The future of council-owned housing in Napier is in limbo, as the city grapples with one of the worst social housing crises in the country.

item.title: Covid-19 vaccines available for all in Whanganui communities
item.description: Covid-19 vaccinations for entire communities in rural Whanganui have begun.

item.title: Baby orca may be shifted to portable pool if bad weather arrives
item.description: A portable pool is being brought on site to hold orphan orca Toa - as an incoming storm looks set to make sea conditions too rough.

item.title: In NZ women are still more likely to present and report the news than appear in it
item.description: Opinion - Women are more visible in the world's news than ever before - but they're still far from achieving parity with men, and this has deeper implications for society Associate Professor Susan Fountaine writes.

item.title: Police shoot gunman at major Auckland intersection after public threatened
item.description: A man who was shot by police at a busy Auckland intersection this morning was threatening a member of the public with a firearm when police took action.

item.title: Police drop technology designed to predict motorists
item.description: Police were developing a high-tech tool to predict motorists' likelihood of getting into serious trouble, according to its first report on safe use of computer algorithms.

item.title: Beneficiary numbers continue to drop as economy recovers from Covid-19
item.description: The latest quarterly figures from the Ministry of Social Development show there are about 11,000 fewer people receiving a benefit, compared to the previous quarter.

item.title: Eli Epiha trial: Matthew Hunt's fellow police officer recounts being shot
item.description: The colleague of slain police officer Matthew Hunt has recounted a "surreal moment" he shared with the gunman - before what felt like an explosion of acid in his hip, as he was shot.

item.title: Covid-19 update 15 July: No new community cases, 5 in MIQ
item.description: There are no new cases of the coronavirus in the community and five in managed isolation and quarantine facilities.

item.title: Fatal police shooting: Officer suffers head injury during incident
item.description: A police officer was injured when he fell and hit his head during the incident in Hamilton last night where a man was fatally shot.
